column1: What was you given participant number?
column2: How easy did you find assembling the furniture with the given instructions?
column3: How enjoyable did you find assembling the furniture with the given instructions?
column4: How useful did you find the arrow that points towards the next step?
column5: How clear did you find where to place the next step?
column6: How sure were you on if a part was to be screwed in or not?
column7: How useful did you find having a guide on where to place the assembly so far while adding the current step?
column8: Any other comments about your experience using these instructions?
Would be useful in real life general use
I would be likely to use this over paper instructions
tracking had to be forced into position rather than being a guide on position
It felt quite useful after I stopped using the tracking stuff
I often preferred looking past the screen over listing the screen. Names of parts on screen were useful for getting the right part
